website_summaries.verdict: This two-ply head gives a fat, low-pitched sound that's ideal for pop, rock, and R&B music styles.
pros: Gives a "fat" sound good for pop, rock, and R&B styles
Low-pitched sound with warm attack and response
Overtone reducing agent between heads provides overtone control

customer_reviews.title: High attack
customer_reviews.text: Attack is SUUPER high. Challenging to play soft on this bad boy. I'm a veteran drummer with 15+ years of playing, and although I love the rim shots this snare skin gives, it definitely makes dynamics a tough goal.
customer_reviews.author: Ü Blue

customer_reviews.title: Best bass drum head for live Rock/Metal.
customer_reviews.text: This is the absolute best bass drum batter side head for live rock/metal drumming. Throw it (and the front head) over a Remo Muf’l & you don’t need any more muffling. Sounds phenomenal when mic’d!
customer_reviews.author: Blkjakk

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: My last drum head was replaced by this one. This head is a batter head and works great. I have tried other brands; but have come back to Remo for all my drum heads. The best keeps getting better
customer_reviews.author: TimmyK

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound Quality
customer_reviews.text: The Head is working great! The sound is wonderful for pop/rock playing. You get a full, deep tone that resonates well. I lightly tuned the bass drum and provided a towel slightly against the head to reduce ringing.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Bretton

customer_reviews.title: Get this head
customer_reviews.text: This head sounds amazing and it goes well with my pearl export series drumset, would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Anston Morales

customer_reviews.title: Drum Head!
customer_reviews.text: Best deal on a drum head we ever bought and we buy lots of them. Excellent condition.
customer_reviews.author: cindy wise

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: This heads can take a punishment , it is a great product from remo and the sound it provides is very well balanced
customer_reviews.author: santi review

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: Has a nice thick bass drum sound. im thoroughly enjoying the sound. has no overtones if you just through a couple blankets inside the drum.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: A higher level of quality
customer_reviews.text: The name stands for a higher level of quality, and they deliver. They sound good and have an understated look.
customer_reviews.author: GFroD1

customer_reviews.title: Ideal, never broken one in 5 years.
customer_reviews.text: I own a number of remo pinstripe heads and they're all ideal. I'll only buy Remo Pinstripe as long as they're on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: product review
customer_reviews.text: arrived very promptly, its loud, i need to put more pillows in bass drum now, but would be excellent for giging
customer_reviews.author: veronica65

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this product
customer_reviews.text: First eye cream that I've tried that does smooth wrinkles. I noticed walking by a mirror in a department store and was shocked that I didn't look as tired around the eyes the way I usually do. I'm 50 and have dark circles as well, it doesn't make them disappear but definitely diminishes them! LOVE this product!!
customer_reviews.author: Reina

customer_reviews.title: join the revolution
customer_reviews.text: Great choice for bass drum! Great punch, depth and fullness all once. Clear Pinstripe on the bass drum may seem old school to some, but you won't be disappointed. Join the revolution back to Clear Pinstripe on the kick! Full disclosure: I have a Yamaha Recording Custom kit and and also a Yamaha Stage Custom (20 inch bass drum with each kit). Have used Powerstroke 3 and also the Powerstroke 4. IMHO, the Remo Pinstripe Clear is the more appropriate choice for these drums. (Used to use the Clear Pinstripe on my Pearl BLX -- for those who remember!) Super versatile bass head. Great punch that's not clicky.
customer_reviews.author: John D.

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre
customer_reviews.text: This bass head is mediocre at best. The sound is great, that isn't a lie, but it does require a pillow to be put in and shoved tight against the bass head for a good rock-n-roll punchy sound. Without a pillow, it still has a decent sound, but it's open and pretty ringy. Better for a genre like jazz, maybe. I've had mine for 4 months as of today (July 6th, 2012), and it is already starting to split. With the low durability, I will not be buying this head again.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter V.

product_meta.title: Remo PS1324-00 Clear Pinstripe Bass Drum Head (24-Inch)
product_meta.description: Style:Pinstripe Clear Bass| Size:24"Clear Pinstripe heads are made with two 7-mil Mylar plies, and have quick decay, making them ideal heads for the "fat" Sounds of pop, rock and R&B and for those who want a low pitched sound with moderate attack and response characteristics.
feature_bullets: 24" diameter clear pinstripe bass drum head
Ideal heads for the "fat" sounds of Pop, Rock and R&B and for those who want a low pitched sound with warm attack and response characteristics
